Creating Time-Series Charts

A time-series chart is a line chart that shows the number of items with the same day, week, or month in the specified time/date field.

The fields shown in a time-series chart depend upon the fields that are displayed on the upper pane and whether the selected chart contains information about items.

To create a time-series chart:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Click Charts > Time Series from the component or context menu. The Time-Series Chart dialog opens. If the upper pane displays no time/date fields, the application displays an error message.

  4. Enter a name for the chart in the Chart text box.

  5. Select Daily, Weekly, or Monthly from the Tracking interval box.

  6. Select one or more items from the Time-Series list box.

  7. (Optional) To include a specific date range for your chart, select the Limit To period of time check box.

  8. (Optional) To display the accumulated items in the chart, select the Cumulative totals check box.

  9. (Optional) To include all date ranges in the chart, select the Include non-represented dates check box.

  10. Do one of the following:

    • To display a chart that includes only the selected items, choose Current selection.

    • To display a chart that includes all items on the upper pane, choose Select all.

  11. Select a page orientation: Portrait or Landscape.

  12. Click OK. StarTeam then displays the chart.

  13. To exit the chart, click Window on the Chart menu, and select a project view.
